description: SENIOR DIRECTOR, HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGEMENT & ADMINISTRATION.

The Senior Director, Human Resource Management & Administration is a member of the executive management team and reports to the President. He/she provides strategic leadership and direction regarding all facets of human resource management and development, which includes promoting and enhancing a diverse workforce, integrating the core values of the University in the culture, establishing effective succession planning, procedures and ensuring equitable salary and benefit structures for the University. He/she ensures that all human resources programmes and initiatives are integrated and effective in supporting the overall mission, goals and objectives of the University. In addition, the Senior Director is responsible for consistent and equitable interpretation of employment policies and serves as an internal consultant for organizational development issues.
title: SENIOR DIRECTOR

description: The PCJ is inviting applications from suitably qualified individuals to fill
the posts of “Energy Engineer”, for a fixed term of two (2) years, with the
The successful candidates will among other duties, be required to:

description: The South East Regional Health Authority (SERHA), a Statutory Body under the Ministry of Health with responsibility for the management and operation of public health services within the parishes of Kingston and St. Andrew, St. Catherine and St. Thomas, is seeking to recruit a dynamic, self-motivated, success-oriented individual to fill the following position: Director — Human Resource Management and Industrial Relations (GMG/SEG 4)

Reporting to the Regional Director, the position is responsible for:

• Developing and communicating in conjunction with Regional Director, and subject to approved policies and procedures, appropriate HRD, HRM and IR policies, systems and procedures for the Authority and its staff (staff complement of approximately 6,000).
• Ensuring that HRD, HRM and IR systems as procedures are implemented by the Authority's line managers.
• Planning, organizing and guiding the activities of the HRM & IR Division to ensure that objectives are achieved and efficiency maintained. Specific Knowledge Required:
• Sound knowledge of laws, procedures and best practices pertaining to industrial relations, employment and terminations, salary/contract administration, employee benefits and welfare.
• Sound knowledge of current techniques of human resources motivation and development.
• Working knowledge of computerized human resource information systems Required Skills and Specialized Techniques:
• Strong interpersonal and negotiating skills; inclusive of counselling, grievance handling, interviewing and coaching.
• Strong oral and written communication skills
• Comprehensive knowledge of the Authority's policies and procedures and of the Act governing the Authority.
• Sound analytical, problem solving, conflict resolution and decision-making skills.

Interested persons may view a copy of the Job Description on the website, www.serha.gov.jm or request that a copy be emailed to them for further details. We thank all applicants for their expressions of interest; however, only those shortlisted will be contacted.

3. Review and report on such matters as breakdown of internal controls; Other conditions of the job include potential physical threat and frequent lifting and moving of heavy computerized documents for reviewing, etc.

description:
Applications are invited from suitably qualified individuals to fill the position of an Executive Assistant.

Reports to: Chief Executive Officer 

SKILLS REQUIREMENT/KEY COMPETENCIES

• Strong decision making and problem solving skills
• Excellent minute taking, word processing and report writing skills
• Highly developed competence in Microsoft Of Suite
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

• Reports to the CEO on all administrative matters for the Executive Office
• Supervise administrative and support staff assigned
• Draft Cabinet Submissions
• Follow up on Cabinet Submissions and disseminate decisions to respective officers
• Prepare annual updates on Cabinet Decisions; prepare presentations for the CEO
• Manage and maintain confidential files, as well as external Board Meeting Files
• Establish and maintain filing and records management system for the office.
• Plan and arrange for internal and external meetings, Retreats etc.
• Prepare travel arrangement and travel itinerary for CEO, visiting Missions and or delegations
• Record minutes of meetings and prepare reports from meetings or from documents
• Attend internal and external meetings
• Conduct research on assigned subjects; collate monthly and special reports
• Provide reminders and advice on priorities and matters requiring urgent attention
• Manage the CEO's diary
• Prioritize documents, letters, calls and visitors needing attention/response

Only short listed applicants will be contacted and we thank all applicants in advance.

description:
Job Summary:

To manage the operations of the College geared at facilitating the education of students in an environment that is conducive to learning, while ensuring adherence to the policies, and procedures of the Ministry of Education (MOE), TCJ, CCCJ, UCJ, MOF and JBTE.Knowledge,

Skills and Competencies:

• Excellent interpersonal, communication and leadership skills
• Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skills
• Proven leadership skills within the sector (TCJ, CCCJ)
• Computer Literate and technologically savvy
• Required to provide leadership for the College's Strategic Plan
• Team oriented
• Excellent planning and organizing skills
• Ability to articulate the College's vision and embody the mission
• Ability to foster and maintain good interpersonal relations and harmonious learning and working environment
• Ability to provide learner-centered leadership for both staff and students
• Excellent oral, written and presentation skills

Duties and Responsibilities: 

• Plans, organizes, directs, controls and implements the educational and operational programmes of the College
• Develops and implements the College's Strategic Plan in collaboration with the Board of Management, Staff and other stakeholders, and ensures that it is aligned with the legal, financial and organizational goals of the College
• Ensures that the College's goals and objectives are in keeping with the policies of the MOE
• Develops and implements schedules, strategies and procedures to ensure the effective and efficient utilization of the College's financial resources to implement its plans and programmes
• Promotes a positive image of the College through ensuring high standards of professionalism on the path of students and staffs
• Establishes and maintains positive relationships among staffs, students, the Board of Management and the community
• Motivates staffs and students to meet the expectations of the College through diligence, time management, community service and display of high levels of professionalism.
• Acts as a role model for staffs and students in terms of deportment, ongoing learning/professional development, professional behaviour, interpersonal relationships and discipline
• Serves as a member of the Board of Management 
• Serves as Ex officio Member of all Committees of the College and the Board.
title: PRINCIPAL

description: The Council of Legal Education invites applications from qualified persons
for the post of Librarian at the Eugene Dupuch Law School, Nassau, The
The successful applicant will be expected to assume duties on Monday,
August 1, 2017. The position is a full-time one and no outside
employment may be undertaken without the prior approval of the Council
of Legal Education. The appointment will be by contract for three (3)
years in the first instance and is renewable.
The Librarian is responsible for providing foreign and international
reference and research service to internal and external patrons. More
particularly, the Librarian is responsible for providing comprehensive
legal reference, research and information service to support the teaching
programme and research capability of the Eugene Dupuch Law School
(EDLS) and is therefore responsible for all aspects of the library
operations of the EDLS. This includes budgeting, hiring and supervision
of library staff, strategic planning with respect to the future growth and
development of the law library, and initiating and monitoring library

description:
Jamaica National Agency For Accreditation The Jamaica National Agency for Accreditation (JANAAC), is an agency of Ministry of Industry, Commerce, Agriculture and Fisheries with responsibility for accrediting Conformity Assessment Bodies (CABs) i.e. laboratories, inspection bodies and certification bodies. Applications are invited from suitably qualified persons to fill the post of Information Technology Officer (MIS IT4).


Major Duties

The Information Technology Officer is responsible for managing all ICT related matters including: maintaining the databases and associated systems efficiently; network security; maintenance of the website and assisting ICT users in identifying and implementing improvements to ensure optimal operations to support the goals of the Agency. The incumbent also provides technical support to JANAAC events and training activities.
Required Competencies

• A team player with good interpersonal, communication, problem-solving, trouble shooting skills.
• Ability to perform basic graphic designs
• Ability to work on own initiative
• Managing external relationships
• A technophile or computer geek
• Thorough understanding of Microsoft Office Suite
title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY OFFICER (MIS IT4)

qualifications:
1. Postgraduate Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or other related discipline plus five (5) years relevant experience of which at least four (4) years should be at the managerial level. OR
2. First Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or other related discipline plus seven (7) years' related working experience of which at least five (5) years should be at the managerial level.
3. Several years' experience in managing and developing the operations and business tools for a regulatory, financial or business institution.
4. Proven experience in establishing effective partnerships within and outside an organization.
5. Professional certification in one or more of the following disciplines Information and Knowledge Management, Business Analysis, Project Management and/or Data Governance.
description: Applications are invited from suitably qualified professionals to fill the position of Head- Information and Knowledge Management, Financial Institutions Supervisory Division (FISD). Reporting to the Division Chief of the FISD, the successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing the work of the Information and Knowledge Management Department for the centralization of supervised institutions' data/information and supervisory knowledge. The incumbent facilitates the integration of information to strengthen the decision-making framework relied on by the FISD to deliver on its supervisory mandate. He or she will also provide leadership in change management and project management and assist business units within FISD in the definition of business requirements for expanding the technological infrastructure relevant to the collection of new data sets. This role will also catalyze division-wide knowledge sharing on matters related to the activities, role and function of the supervisory arm of the Bank so that know-how, information and experience can be preserved, shared and enhanced.

SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED

1. In-depth knowledge in the use of best of breed software for the collection of data, business intelligence analytics and forecasting and presentation tools.
2. In-depth knowledge of the risks involved in the application of technology.
3. Demonstrated expertise in data management, analysis and planning.
4. Demonstrated good understanding of supervisory legislation, rules, regulations, codes and standards. 5. Strong leadership, strategic management, organizational and human relations skills.
title: HEAD - INFORMATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT, FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS SUPERVISORY DIVISION

qualifications: PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
• Preparing tender and contract documents, including bills of quantities.

description: We are the largest retailer in the region, offering many opportunities for growth and development and are looking for a talented and dedicated individual to fill the position of Business Development Manager. Reporting to the Business Unit Director, the Business Development Manager will be responsible for improving the organization's market position and achieving financial growth by building key customer relationships, identifying business opportunities, negotiating and closing business deals. The ideal candidate will maintain an extensive knowledge of current market conditions, and is focused on increasing sales opportunities and thereby maximizing revenue for the organization.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE RESPONSIBILITY FOR:

• Prospecting for new clients by networking, cold calling, advertising or other means of generating interest from potential clients and converting this into increased business
• Identifying opportunities for campaigns, services, and distribution channels that will lead to an increase in sales
• Growing and retaining existing accounts by presenting new solutions and services to customers Presenting to and consulting with the management team on business trends with a view to developing new services, products, and distribution channels Using knowledge of the market and competitors to identify and develop the company's unique selling propositions.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

description: We are the largest retailer in the region, offering many opportunities for growth and development and are looking for a talented and dedicated individual to become part of our dynamic team.
(CREDIT GRANTING)

THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL BE RESPONSIBLE TO:

• Develop and implement strategies to promote the growth of the credit business
• Assist in developing sound and acceptable credit policies to maintain an acceptable credit risk management environment
• Implement and maintain a process to achieve consistency in credit decisions
• Create and maintain customer service environment by meeting credit approval targets
• Participate in the strategic and business planning process for the company
• Establish and communicate department goals and performance results to subordinates
• Evaluate and analyze performance weekly against targets
• Maintain a departmental structure that supports meeting goals and objectives
• Visit branches island-wide to promote collaboration and to ensure that standards are achieved
• Coach and develop staff to ensure achievement of Key Performance Indicators and targets
• Supervise a large team of Supervisors and Credit Underwriters
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

description: The Jamaica Information Service (JIS), an Executive Agency of the Government of Jamaica invites applications from suitably qualified Journalists and Public Relations Officers for the position of Freelance Reporters.

The successful candidates will be required to produce accurate and well written news releases, feature stories and photographs/captions emerging from assignments in all parishes and in the Diaspora on behalf of the JIS.

Produce News Releases, Feature Stories, Photographs/ Captions for print on request from the Managing Editor, Editorial Department. News Releases, Feature Stories, Photographs/Captions must be of acceptable journalistic standards. 

Submit all News Releases, Feature Stories and Photographs/ Captions to the Managing Editor of the Editorial Department within deadlines.
